repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: Enables possibility to use kw_only option like in `dataclasesses.dataclass` requested in https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/4303

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
@dataclass(kw_only=True)
```

You can run the tests in this file locally on your PC with `python runtest.py cdef_class_dataclass` just to confirm that it works.
I think this is the only time that we do this, and we only need the value in one place. We should keep the `kwargs` handling consistent here and look it up where we need it below.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -221,6 +222,8 @@ def handle_cclass_dataclass(node, dataclass_args, analyse_decs_transform):
 
     fields = process_class_get_fields(node)
 
+    kw_only = kwargs.pop("kw_only")

@@ -221,6 +222,8 @@ def handle_cclass_dataclass(node, dataclass_args, analyse_decs_transform):
 
     fields = process_class_get_fields(node)
 
+    kw_only = kwargs.pop("kw_only")
+

@@ -250,7 +253,7 @@ def handle_cclass_dataclass(node, dataclass_args, analyse_decs_transform):
     code_lines = []
     placeholders = {}
     extra_stats = []
-    for cl, ph, es in [ generate_init_code(kwargs['init'], node, fields),
+    for cl, ph, es in [ generate_init_code(kwargs['init'], node, fields, kw_only),

comment_data.body:
Let's also test that default arguments are correctly handled.
```suggestion
    >>> fail = TestKwOnly(a=3)
    Traceback (most recent call last):
    TypeError: __init__() needs keyword-only argument b
    >>> fail = TestKwOnly()
    Traceback (most recent call last):
    TypeError: __init__() needs keyword-only argument b
    """
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -224,6 +224,25 @@ cdef class TestFrozen:
     """
     a: double = 2.0
 
+@dataclass(kw_only=True)
+cdef class TestKwOnly:
+    """
+    >>> inst = TestKwOnly(a=3, b=2)
+    >>> inst.a
+    3.0
+    >>> inst.b
+    2
+    >>> fail = TestKwOnly(3, 2)
+    Traceback (most recent call last):
+    TypeError: __init__() takes exactly 0 positional arguments (2 given)
+    >>> fail = TestKwOnly(a=3)
+    Traceback (most recent call last):
+    TypeError: __init__() needs keyword-only argument b
+    """

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    >>> inst = TestKwOnly(a=3, b=2)
    >>> inst.a
    3.0
    >>> inst.b
    2
    >>> inst = TestKwOnly(b=2)
    >>> inst.a
    2.0
    >>> inst.b
    2
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -224,6 +224,25 @@ cdef class TestFrozen:
     """
     a: double = 2.0
 
+@dataclass(kw_only=True)
+cdef class TestKwOnly:
+    """
+    >>> inst = TestKwOnly(a=3, b=2)
+    >>> inst.a
+    3.0
+    >>> inst.b
+    2

comment_data.body: but `_DataclassParams` doesn't have a `kw_only` argument (neither in regular dataclasses)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -221,6 +222,8 @@ def handle_cclass_dataclass(node, dataclass_args, analyse_decs_transform):
 
     fields = process_class_get_fields(node)
 
+    kw_only = kwargs.pop("kw_only")

comment_data.body: Hmm. Ok. Sorry, I didn't read the code completely. So, you were only using `kwargs` for the keyword parsing here and it's otherwise passed straight into dataclass params. I reverted my change and added a comment on why it is done this way. It's not obvious from the code as such.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -221,6 +222,8 @@ def handle_cclass_dataclass(node, dataclass_args, analyse_decs_transform):
 
     fields = process_class_get_fields(node)
 
+    kw_only = kwargs.pop("kw_only")

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: dataclasses: enable kw_only dataclasses
